---
description: Install on Render
---

# Install on Render

## 1. Use the 1-click deploy button

[![Deploy to Render](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Deploy%20to%20Render-44E4B4?style=for-the-badge&logo=data:image/png;base64,&logoColor=ffffff)](https://render.com/deploy?repo=https://github.com/Squidex/squidex)

## 2. Fill in the details

Fill the `Service Group Name` and then fill the `DOMAIN` variable with the external domain you wish your Squidex instance to be available on.

You can leave the `Branch` field at the default `master`.

![Fill Details](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-2.png)

When you are done, click `Apply`.

## 3. Wait for the deployment to complete

![Deployment Started](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-3-1.png)

![Deployment Finished](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-3-2.png)

When it's finished, click `managed resources`.

## 4. Get the external URL

Click `squidex_squidex`.

![Open squidex_squidex](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-4-1.png)

Your URL will be just below the service name.

![Get URL](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-4-2.png)

You should then be ready to go!

## Troubleshooting

Please check the logs by clicking `Logs` in the service page.

![Logs](../../../.gitbook/assets/render-troubleshooting.png)

### More issues?

It is very likely a configuration problem and not related to hosting under Docker. Checkout

{% page-ref page="../configuration.md" %}
